blockquote.p: The class template match_results shall satisfy the requirements of an allocator-aware container and of a sequence container, as specified in , except that only operations defined for const-qualified sequence containers are supported.

discussion.p:

The missing sequence constructors are:
The missing allocator-aware container constructors are:

blockquote.pre: match_results(const match_results&, const Allocator&); match_results(match_results&&, const Allocator&);

discussion.p:
It should be clarified, whether (a) constructors are an exception of above mentioned operations or (b) whether at least some of them (like those accepting a match_results value and an allocator) should be added.
As visible in several places of the standard (including the core language), constructors seem usually to be considered as "operations" and they certainly can be invoked for const-qualified objects.
The below given proposed resolution applies only the minimum necessary fix, i.e. it excludes constructors from above requirement.
Check current implementations to see what they do and, possibly, write a paper.
Ask Daniel to update the proposed wording to include the allocator copy and move constructors.

blockquote.p: The class template match_results shall satisfy the requirements of an allocator-aware container and of a sequence container, as specified in , except that only operations defined for const-qualified sequence containers that are not constructors are supported.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N3376.

li.p: Change p4, class template match_results synopsis, as indicated:

Change as indicated: [Drafting note: Paragraph 6 as currently written, makes not much sense, because the noexcept does not allow any exception to propagate. Further-on, the allocator requirements do not allow for throwing move constructors. Deleting it seems to be near to editorial — end drafting note]

blockquote.pre: match_results(const match_results& m); match_results(const match_results& m, const Allocator& a);

blockquote.p: -4- Effects: Constructs an object of class match_results, as a copy of m.

blockquote.pre: match_results(match_results&& m) noexcept; match_results(match_results&& m, const Allocator& a) noexcept;

blockquote.p:
-5- Effects: Move-constructs an object of class match_results from m satisfying the same postconditions as Table 142. AdditionallyFor the first form, the stored Allocator value is move constructed from m.get_allocator().
-6- Throws: Nothing if the allocator's move constructor throws nothing.
